p: With this algorithm, we were able to confirm an experimental model of BPD with hyperoxia. Indeed, newborn mice from postnatal (PN) 1 to PN 4 were exposed to 80% oxygen (hyperoxia) and compared with newborn exposed to 21% oxygen (normoxia). The mice exposed to hyperoxia presented drastic changes in density of closed area, a diminution of the relative frequency of closed area under 1,000 mm ( 2) (alveoli and saccules) and an augmentation of closed area over 1,000 mm ( 2) compared to mice in normoxia ( 43). These changes correspond to an alveolar simplification which is the major characteristic of BPD ( 14, 15).
